title: Poland: Citi Handlowy CEO in Bloomberg Businessweek Polska's Top-20 Best Managers List
summary: Warsaw, Poland - Slawomir S. Sikora, CEO of Citi Handlowy, earned a spot in a prestigious list of the top 20 most effective managers in this Bloomberg Businessweek Polska's "TOP 20 Best Managers in Times of Crisis" awards 2012.
tag-1: Poland: Citi Handlowy CEO in Bloomberg Businessweek Polska's Top-20 Best Managers List
tag-2: Warsaw, Poland – Slawomir S. Sikora, CEO of Citi Handlowy, earned a spot in a prestigious list of the top 20 most effective managers in this Bloomberg Businessweek Polska's "TOP 20 Best Managers in Times of Crisis" awards 2012.
tag-3: Other CEOs who made the top-20 list included heads of Poland's most important businesses: CEO of KGHM, the eighth largest producer of copper and largest producer of silver in the world); CEO of PZU, Poland's largest insurance company; CEO of ENEA SA, Poland's third largest electricity producer; and the CEO of the second-largest fuel company in Poland - Lotos Group.
tag-4: Bloomberg Businessweek Polska noted: "All from the TOP 20 list deserve being congratulated both for effective supervision over companies and for being valued by heads of other companies. We have not ranked them. The list is arranged in alphabetical order."
tag-5: The "TOP 20 Best Managers in Times of Crisis" award is granted as recognition to managers and, above all, to businesses that, despite unfavorable market conditions, manage to grow their operations. The list was prepared based on the opinions of experienced managers and market observers from various industries.
tag-6: Bloomberg Businessweek Polska is a Polish-language edition of one of the world's most influential magazines. It was launched in September 2011.
tag-7: Citi Citigroup, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citigroup provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com.

tag-9: Citi Handlowy  Citi Handlowy is one of the major financial institutions in Poland and offers, under the Citi Handlowy brand, a broad range of state-of-the-art products in corporate, investment and consumer banking. Through its modern distribution channels and a network of 96 branches, Bank Handlowy services over 20,000 corporate customers and over 900,000 individual ones. The Bank's group includes Dom Maklerski Citi Handlowy (brokerage house) and Handlowy Leasing. Being a member of Citi enables the customers of Bank Handlowy access to financial services provided in over 100 countries. Further information is available at www.citihandlowy.pl.
